    • Method Detail

      • displayName

        String displayName()
        Implement this method to add a name for your vault connector. The specified name is displayed in the "Select Connector Version" drop-down list on the Add/Update Connection page of your vault connector.
        Returns:
        The displayName string

      • version

        String version()
        Implement this method to add a version for your vault connector. The specified version is displayed in the "Select Connector Version" drop-down list on the Add/Update Connection page of your vault connector.
        Returns:
        The version string

      • getSecret

        Map getSecret​(Map<String,​Object> vaultConfigData,
              Map<String,​Object> data)
       throws ConnectorException
        Implement this method to retrieve secrets from the target vault application.
        Parameters:
        vaultConfigData - Stores the name of the secret key (such as password).
        data - Stores the name of the connection parameters used to connect with the target vault application.
        Returns:
        A map that contains encryptedConnAttr and status of whether the secret is obtained or not.
        Throws:
        ConnectorException - When the connection fails.

      • setSecret

        Map setSecret​(Map<String,​Object> vaultConfigData,
              Map<String,​Object> data)
       throws ConnectorException
        Implement this method to save your secrets in the target vault application when you create or update them
        Parameters:
        vaultConfigData - Stores the name of the secret key (such as password).
        data - Stores the name of the connection parameters used to connect with the target vault application.
        Returns:
        A map that contains the status of whether the secret is set or not.
        Throws:
        ConnectorException - When the connection fails.

  throws ConnectorException,
         InvalidCredentialException,
         InvalidAttributeValueException,
         OperationTimeoutException,

        This method is used to test the connection with the vault.

        Throws:

      • setVaultConfig

        void setVaultConfig​(VaultConfigVo configData)
        Implement this method to configure the connection parameters. These parameters are displayed on the Add/Update Connection page of your vault connector.
        • Define all connection parameters by adding them in configData.getConnectionAttributes() list.
        • Define mandatory connection parameters by adding them in configData.getRequiredConnectionAttributes() list.
        • Define encrypted connection parameters by adding them in configData.getEncryptedConnectionAttributes() list.
        • Add description for connection parameters using configData.setConnectionAttributesDescription(jsonObject.toString())
        Parameters:
        configData - The vault config data

      • getVaultConfig

        VaultConfigVo getVaultConfig()
        This is for internal use and should not be implemented.

      • dataFormatting

        Map dataFormatting​(Map vaultConfigJSON)
        Implement this method to modify the value of vaultConfigData parameter before passing it to getSecret() or setSecret() method. For example, if you want to modify the value of the keyName attribute, define the new value of keyName in the keyMapping.put() method in the following format: 
        keyMapping.put("keyName", "newabcd215");
        Note: Saviynt recommends that you skip this method if you do not want to modify the value of vaultConfigData parameter.
        Parameters:
        vaultConfigJSON - The vault config json
        Returns:
        a map containing vaultConfigJSON which can be modified as per the requirement. This formatted map will be used as new vaultConfigData in getSecret and setSeret methods. If no modification is required, return null.
